headline: Mongolia backs down from local banking rule
text:
The man in charge of Rio Tinto's Mongolian copper ambitions will relocate to Ulaan Baatar, as the miner seeks to build its representation in the developing Asian nation.

Rio is building a $US5.3 billion expansion of the Oyu Tolgoi copper project in Mongolia, and is keen to avoid nationalistic flare-ups like the one that saw Mongolia threaten to force foreign investors to funnel money through Mongolian banks.

The proposal would have contravened the Oyu Tolgoi investment agreement if enforced, but Mongolian politicians agreed to abandon the plan in recent days, much to the relief of foreign investors in the nation.

The proposed banking law prompted the International Monetary Fund to delay a bail out of the Mongolian economy just over a week ago.
